Reason for Starting the Project\nThis app is a service created from our team\'s experience with side projects over the past few years. Many side projects are looking for people to collaborate with, but the methods were somewhat manual.

This year marks the beginning of a new era,\nand the reason to believe that next year presents an opportunity to create the next chapter for a better world is right here.
People work better when they know their goals and the reasons behind them.\nIt is essential for people to eagerly look forward to going to work and finding joy in their tasks every morning.
If you believe it\'s right, push through to the end.\nStarting with small tasks can lead to accomplishing great things.\nIn the end, those with conviction emerge victorious.

Leap forward with determination in your steps, contemplation in your heart, and action in your body.\nJust as a tree cannot grow under a larger tree, humans can grow into someone even greater under the guidance of a mentor.
\'Right Time, Right Action\' is crucial.\nBusiness success hinges on taking appropriate actions at the right time.\nMissing the timing renders the effort meaningless.

We are at the starting point of a transition. If you haven\'t figured out how to use AI yet, you are not alone. Just as many people did not use the internet at first, over time, everyone realized the convenience of using email, shopping online, and using search engines. It\'s natural that everyone will use AI one day. One of my favorite innovation stories is that the number of children under 5 who die worldwide has halved since 2000. AI tools can accelerate the pace of drug development. Although there is still a gap, it is much shorter than the gap seen in other technological innovations. With wise investments, AI can make the world a fairer place. When I was young, I didn\'t care about holidays or weekends, but since becoming a father, I realized that there are more important things in life than work. I hope you spend the holiday season with your loved ones before 2024 begins.

McDonald\'s to Introduce Google\'s AI in All Global Stores\nMcDonald\'s has announced the implementation of Google\'s artificial intelligence (AI) technology in all its stores worldwide. While specific details were not disclosed, it appears that AI chatbots will be integrated into kiosks and dedicated mobile apps, with AI technology applied to cameras within the stores. McDonald\'s stated that it will leverage Google\'s hardware, data, and AI technology to provide a better experience for both customers and employees. As part of the partnership, McDonald\'s plans significant developments, ranging from its mobile app used by 150 million people to thousands of self-service kiosks. For more details, click here.

9 Strategies to Keep the Development Team Happy\nThe increasing demand for software developers is no secret, even in uncertain economic conditions. Companies are exerting efforts to find and retain individuals skilled in coding. In such situations, an essential question for development team leaders is understanding the factors that make developers satisfied in their profession. It\'s crucial to identify the issues. In situations where there are many options, developers are less likely to stay in a job that doesn\'t meet their expectations. The job satisfaction of developers takes top priority for every company aspiring to create high-quality software. Various developers and IT professionals were asked about the factors that make developers happy at work. Here are their responses. For more information, click here.

"KakaoT Overseas Call Service Grows Over 7 Times Compared to Last Year"\nKakao Mobility\'s taxi platform, KakaoT, reported significant growth in overseas call service usage during the first quarter of this year, with over 7 times the volume compared to the same period last year. Kakao Mobility revealed this information in an end-of-year report containing various data on KakaoT\'s overseas mobility services. For more details, click here.

The Best Choice for Modernizing IT Infrastructure: \'STaaS\'\nIT infrastructure supports companies in seizing new opportunities and adapting to constantly changing customer demands. With the advent of the era of cloud computing, companies are under pressure to provide a flexible IT infrastructure with features such as continuous operation, unlimited on-demand capacity, and preparedness for operational disruptions and failures. For more information, click here.

Google Settles \'Antitrust Lawsuit\' for 910 Billion Wonâ€¦ Changes in Android Phone Payment Systems\nGoogle has agreed to settle the antitrust lawsuit filed by over 30 U.S. states regarding the alleged coercion of its in-app payment system. Google announced on the 18th (local time) that it will pay a settlement of 7 billion dollars (approximately 910 billion won) to resolve the lawsuit. For more details, click here.
